name: A. Serval and String Theory
statement:
A string r consisting only of lowercase Latin letters is called if and
only if r is lexicographically smaller^{
text{ }} than the reversal^{
text{ }} of r.You are given a string s consisting of n lowercase Latin
letters. You are required to make s . To achieve this, you can perform
the following operation on s k times: Choose two indices i and j (1
le i,j
le n), then swap s_i and s_j. Note that if i=j, you do nothing.
Determine whether you can make s by performing the above operation at
most k times.^{
text{ }}A string a is lexicographically smaller than a string b of the
same length, if and only if the following holds: in the first position
where a and b differ, the string a has a letter that appears earlier in
the alphabet than the corresponding letter in b. ^{
text{ }}The reversal of a string r is the string obtained by writing r
from right to left. For example, the reversal of the string
texttt{abcad} is
texttt{dacba}.
